Q: We need to be self aware of the influence/power we hold over others (whether intended or not) and be empathetic and supportive enough to help others recognize the power they have as a member of the team. Everyone has a voice but do they know, or believe, that their input is needed and valued? This is key for inclusiveness.

Q: Our group talked about how leaders don't always realize that when they speak first or early that they change the direction of the conversation and may shut down thoughts or conflict. For example, I had a boss who would come in and say "So here's the project we are being asked to do. We need to do this, this, this and this and we should consider this, this and this. Any questions? Can we start brainstorming?" But almost no one would talk because she already drove the entire conversation.
